document.masterDocTitle: A review of the mite subfamily Harpirhynchinae (Acariformes: Harpirhynchidae) — parasites of New World birds (Aves: Neognathae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Harpyrhynchoides kirgizorum , Fain et al. 1999 : 42
, figs. 7–12 .

Additional material . Five females and
1 male
( UMMZ BMOC 11 -0201-001, # 1–6 ) from
Catharus minimus (Lafresnaye)
( Passeriformes : Turdidae ) ( UMMZ 242485 ), [on skin of head],
USA
: Michigan, Washtenaw Co., 3 mi SE Dexter,
42.3055625 °N
,
83.8418197 °W
, summer 2008 , coll. N. Green; all specimens deposited in UMMZ ;
14 females
and
2 males
( UMMZ BMOC 09-0424-001, # 1–16 ) from
Sialia sialis
Linnaeus ( Passeriformes : Turdidae ) ( UMMZ 242029 ) [on skin of body],
USA
: Michigan, Houghton Co., Atlantic Mine,
47.0981165 °N
,
88.6280393 °W
,
26 April 2007
, coll. P. Quenzi; most specimens deposited in UMMZ , except
2 females
in ZISP and 2 in OSAL .

Passeriformes ( Thraupidae ):
Diuca diuca
(Molina) from South America (unknown locality) (
Fain 1972
).

Passeriformes ( Icteridae ):
Sturnella magna (Linnaeus)
,
Sturnella neglecta Audubon
,
Euphagus cyanocephalus (Wagler)
,
Agelaius tricolor
(Audubon),
Agelaius phoeniceus
(Linnaeus) from USA (various localities) (
Bochkov & Klompen 2014 b
) and
Euphagus carolinus (Muller)
from USA (Wisconsin) (
Chaddock 1941
) and from unknown locality in North America (
Bochkov & Klompen 2014 b
),
Quiscalus quiscula
(Linnaeus) from Canada (Manitoba) (
Bochkov & Galloway 2001
).

Passeriformes ( Emberizidae ):
Emberiza calandra (Linnaeus)
from Kirghizia (Fain et al . 1999 ).
